channel.title: Black Node - The Centre [Liquid Jazz][Thoughtful Noise]
channel.description:
[Black Node - The Centre [Thoughtful Noise / TN06]](https://soundcloud.com/thoughtfulnoise/blacknode-the-centre)
#Jazz Fusion #Liquid Jazz #Jazz #Electronic #Nu-Jazz #Liquid Funk #170pm
[![Cover-Black-Node-The-Centre-1000x1000|500x500, 75%](upload://21nTNcHmkHf4KLqLReg4N2d2aRW.jpeg)](https://soundcloud.com/thoughtfulnoise/blacknode-the-centre)
As always, thoughts, comments, feedback all welcome — here or on the SC post.
Thanks and enjoy! :+1:

item.title: Black Node - The Centre [Liquid Jazz][Thoughtful Noise]
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Hey, thanks @Fuujiya.
I appreciate it.

Re: the rhythm… I’m trying to use cut-up beats from more live-sounding drumming, especially for alternative jazz-style drumming, as I’d ultimately like to use a live drummer (for the Black Node tracks). I’m still not putting in the amount of work to better emulate live drumming though — the natural variance that a live drummer will bring.

Re: The chill section. I do find myself adding a breakdown to most tracks; something to let listeners rest their ears before pushing ahead, especially when the track is quite energetic. This time I thought I’d throw in an alternative vibe, switching out the 170 for a half-time broken beat.

Re: The pads (your comment on SC). Again, the Black Node tracks are jazz-electronic oriented, so I like to use rich, warm, extended jazzy chords.

I’m still working on a distinct Black Node sound.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Node - The Centre [Liquid Jazz][Thoughtful Noise]
